parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

description: A findings domain that contains the findings about an event or intervention that cannot be represented within an events or interventions domain record or as a supplemental qualifier. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C85442, 2021-06-25)

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.
fields.label: Study Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: STUDYID
fields.questionText: What is the study identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.
fields.label: Study Site Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: SITEID
fields.questionText: What is the site identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
fields.definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.
fields.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: SUBJID
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
fields.implementationNotes: The name of the clinical encounter is typically pre-printed or displayed within the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.
fields.label: Visit Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: VISIT
fields.questionText: What is the visit name?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
fields.implementationNotes: The date the finding about measurements were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the FA CRF using the Findings About Date (FADAT) field.
fields.label: Visit Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation, or specimen collection can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable FADTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: VISDAT
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

priorVersion.title: Findings About Object of the Observation

rootItem.title: Findings About Object of the Observation

self.title: Findings About Object of the Observation

fields.completionInstructions: [Protocol-specific]
fields.definition: A description of the object or focal point of the findings observation that is represented by FATEST.
fields.implementationNotes: The FAOBJ will usually be pre-printed or hidden, not solicited as an actual question. These FA domains are usually created by the sponsor.
fields.label: Findings About Object of the Observation
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: FAOBJ
fields.questionText: [Sponsored-defined phrase]

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate if the there are findings. If Yes, include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.
fields.definition: An indication of whether data was collected for the finding topic.
fields.implementationNotes: This is a field that can be used in any CRF to indicate whether there is data to record. Used primarily as a data cleaning field, it provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank. FAPERF should be used to capture a response about whether planned measurements, tests, or observations were done.
fields.label: Findings About Collected
fields.mappingInstructions: Does not map to an SDTM variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.
fields.name: FAYN
fields.questionText: Has the subject had any [Findings topic(s)] (after/before [study specific time frame])?; [Was/Were] (there) any [Findings topic(s)] (reported) (after/before [study specific time frame])?; Were all eligibility criteria met?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate if the [FATESTs] was/were collected. If Yes, include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.
fields.definition: An indication of whether a planned measurement, series of measurements, test, observation or specimen was performed or collected.
fields.implementationNotes: This field is used to capture a response to whether a planned measurement, test or observation was performed. A negative response can be collected as "N" and mapped to the FASTAT variable in SDTM as "NOT DONE".
fields.label: Findings About Performed
fields.mappingInstructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into the SDTM variable FASTAT. If the CDASH variable FAPERF="N", the value of the STDM variable FASTAT is "OT DONE". If FAPERF="Y", FASTAT is null. A combination of SDTM variables (e.g., FACAT and FASCAT, FATPT) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTM variable FATESTCD would be populated with FAALL and an appropriate test name (FATEST) provided. See SDTMIG for additional information.
fields.name: FAPERF
fields.questionText: [Were any/Was the] [FATEST/topic] ([measurement(s)/test(s)/examination(s)/specimen(s)/sample(s))] [performed/collected]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record date of measurements using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: The date when the findings about assessment was performed, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: The date the FA measurements were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the FA CRF using the Date of Collection (FADAT) field.
fields.label: Findings About Assessment Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTM variable FADTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: FADAT
fields.questionText: What was the date the findings about assessment was performed?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record time of measurement (as complete as possible).
fields.definition: The time of measurement, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
fields.implementationNotes: Collect time if it is relevant for the analysis.
fields.label: Findings About Assessment Time
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable VSDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: FATIM
fields.questionText: What was the time of the findings about assessment?

implements.title: Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the name of the FATEST if not pre-printed on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.
fields.definition: Descriptive name for the test being performed.
fields.implementationNotes: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included in the column heading.
fields.label: Findings About Test Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The SDTM variable FATESTCD may be determined from the value collected in FATEST. The SDTMIG variables FATESTCD and FATEST are required in SDTM.
fields.name: FATEST
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the name (of the [measurement/test/examination])?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the detail of the [FATEST], if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A further description of FATESTCD and FATEST.
fields.implementationNotes: It is recommended that the test detail name be pre-printed on the CRF. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test," "Test Name" can be included in the column heading.
fields.label: Findings About Test Detail
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: FATSTDTL
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the [measurement/test/examination] detail name?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the FA category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This is most commonly either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included in the column heading.
fields.label: Category for Findings About
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: FACAT
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the [type/category/name] (of the [measurement/test/examination/specimen/sample])?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the FA subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A sub-division of the FACAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This is most commonly either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included in the column heading. FASCAT can only be used if there is an FACAT, and it must be a subcategorization of FACAT.
fields.label: Subcategory for Findings About
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: FASCAT
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the [type/subcategory/name] (of the [measurement/test/examination/specimen/sample])?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71148

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the position of the subject during the FA test.
fields.definition: The position of the subject during a measurement or examination.
fields.label: Findings About Position of Subject
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: FAPOS
fields.questionText: In what position was the subject during the [measurement/ test/examination/specimen collection/sample collection]?; What was the position of the subject (during the [measurement/test/examination/specimen collection/sample collection])?

implements.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

priorVersion.title: FA Result or Finding in Original Units

rootItem.title: FA Result or Finding in Original Units

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

self.title: FA Result or Finding in Original Units

fields.completionInstructions: Record the FATEST result.
fields.definition: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.
fields.implementationNotes: Both quantitative results and interpretive findings or summaries may be recorded here.
fields.label: FA Result or Finding in Original Units
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: FAORRES
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the [result/amount/(subject's) characteristic] (of the [measurement/test/examination/question/assessment])?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Select the unit of measure associated with the test, or record if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.
fields.implementationNotes: Should be pre-printed on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a free-text field. Should be included if applicable and not available elsewhere.
fields.label: FA Original Units
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: FAORRESU
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the unit (of the [measurement/test/examination])?

implements.title: Normal Range Lower Limit- Original Units

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

priorVersion.title: FA Normal Range Lower Limit- Orig Unit

rootItem.title: FA Normal Range Lower Limit- Orig Unit

self.title: FA Normal Range Lower Limit- Orig Unit

fields.completionInstructions: Record the lower limit of the reference range of the FA test.
fields.definition: The lower end of normal range or reference range for continuous results stored in FAORRES.
fields.implementationNotes: --ORNRLO should be populated only for continuous findings. The SDTM variable --STNRC should be populated only for noncontinuous results. These data may be obtained from the lab or the electronic equipment, or could be derived from a site- or lab-specific set of normal ranges stored in a look-up table.
fields.label: FA Normal Range Lower Limit- Orig Unit
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: FAORNRLO
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the lower limit of the reference range (for the [measurement/test/examination])?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

priorVersion.title: FA Normal Range Upper Limit- Orig Unit

rootItem.title: FA Normal Range Upper Limit- Orig Unit

self.title: FA Normal Range Upper Limit- Orig Unit

fields.completionInstructions: Record the upper limit of the reference range of the FA test.
fields.definition: The upper end of normal range or reference range for continuous results stored in FAORRES.
fields.implementationNotes: --ORNRHI should be populated only for continuous findings. The SDTM variable --STNRC should be populated only for noncontinuous results. These data may be obtained from the lab or the electronic equipment, or could be derived from a site- or lab-specific set of normal ranges stored in a look-up table.
fields.label: FA Normal Range Upper Limit- Orig Unit
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: FAORNRHI
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the upper limit of the reference range (for the [measurement/test/examination])?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78736

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record where the test results were categorized within the respective reference range (e.g. HIGH, LOW, ABNORMAL).
fields.definition: An indication or description about how the value compares to the normal range or reference range.
fields.implementationNotes: Reference ranges may be defined by FAORNRLO, FAORNRHI, FASTNRC or other objective criteria. Reference Range Indicator may be included if not derived or determined programmatically after data collection. Should not be used to indicate clinical significance.
fields.label: Findings About Reference Range Indicator
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: FANRIND
fields.questionText: How [did/do] the reported values compare within the [reference/normal/expected] range?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66789

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate if the [FATEST] measurement was not done.
fields.definition: This variable is used to indicate that data are not available, by having the site recording the value as "Not Done".
fields.implementationNotes: Used only when the response value is collected as NOT DONE or NULL in lieu of or in addition to the CDASH FAPERF field. Typically a checkbox which indicates the test was NOT DONE. This field can be useful when multiple questions are asked to confirm that a blank result field is meant to be blank.
fields.label: Findings About Completion Status
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. If collected, the Origin (a column in the Define-XML) ="CRF", if populated from other sources such as a free text or sponsor-defined listing for FAREASND, the Origin ="DERIVED".
fields.name: FASTAT
fields.questionText: Was the [--TEST ] not [completed/answered/done/assessed/evaluated ]?; Indicate if the([--TEST] was) not [answered/assessed/done/evaluated/performed].

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Provide the reason why an FA test was not collected.
fields.definition: An explanation of why data are not available.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology may be used. The reason the data are not available may be chosen from a sponsor-defined codelist (e.g., broken equipment, subject refused, etc.) or entered as free text. When --REASND is used, --STAT should also be populated in the SDTM-based dataset.
fields.label: Findings About Reason Not Performed
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: FAREASND
fields.questionText: Was the [is/was] the reason that the [Findings topic/data/information/sponsor-defined phrase] was not [collected/answered/done/assessed/evaluated]?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78734

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the specimen material type.
fields.definition: The type of specimen used for a measurement.
fields.implementationNotes: The type of specimen used for a measure. Should be collected if not available elsewhere, or if required to differentiate multiple specimens.
fields.label: Findings About Specimen Type
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: FASPEC
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the specimen type?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78733

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the condition of the specimen.
fields.definition: Description of the condition of the specimen.
fields.implementationNotes: May be collected using free or standardized text. Results may be affected by whether conditions for specimen were properly met. When local processing is used, sponsors may not routinely collect specimen condition.
fields.label: Findings About Specimen Condition
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: FASPCCND
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the condition of the specimen?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C74456

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record or select location on body where the measurement was performed, if not pre-printed on CRF.
fields.definition: The anatomical location of the subject, relevant to the collection of the measurement.
fields.implementationNotes: Collected or pre-printed when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location (e.g., ARM for blood pressure). Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, and PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.
fields.label: Location of the Finding About
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: FALOC
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the anatomical location (of the [measurement/test/examination]) or What [is/was] the anatomical location where the [measurement/specimen] was taken/collected)?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99073

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

priorVersion.title: Laterality of Location of Finding About

rootItem.title: Laterality of Location of Finding About

self.title: Laterality of Location of Finding About

fields.completionInstructions: Record the side of the anatomical location of the [FATEST] measurement.
fields.definition: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the side of the body.
fields.implementationNotes: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: Laterality of Location of Finding About
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: FALAT
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the side (of the anatomical location of the [measurement/test/examination])?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99074

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the directionality.
fields.definition: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location, relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.
fields.implementationNotes: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: Findings About Directionality
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: FADIR
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the directionality (of the anatomical location of the [measurement/test/examination])?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99075

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate the portion or totality anatomical location.
fields.definition: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the distribution (i.e.,arrangement of, apportioning of).
fields.implementationNotes: Collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific portionality for the anatomical locations of the location of the FATEST. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: FA Location Portion or Totality
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: FAPORTOT
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the portion or totality (of the anatomical location of the [measurement/test/examination])?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C85492

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the method used for the measurement, test, or examination.
fields.definition: Method of the test or examination.
fields.label: Findings About Method
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: FAMETHOD
fields.questionText: What was the method (used for the [measurement/test/examination])?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the lead used for measurement.
fields.definition: The lead or leads identified to capture the measurement for a test from an instrument.
fields.label: Findings About Lead
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: FALEAD
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the lead (used to measure [measurement/test/examination])?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record whether the subject was fasting prior to the test being performed.
fields.definition: An indication that the subject has abstained from food/water for the specified amount of time.
fields.implementationNotes: Results may be affected by whether the subject was fasting. This may not be relevant for all tests.
fields.label: Findings About Fasting Status
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: FAFAST
fields.questionText: [Is/Was] the subject fasting (prior to the [test being performed/sample being collected])?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78735

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Select the role of the person who provided the evaluation (e.g., INVESTIGATOR, ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE, VENDOR).
fields.definition: The role of the person providing the evaluation.
fields.implementationNotes: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be a pre-printed, or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: Findings About Evaluator
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: FAEVAL
fields.questionText: Who provided the (sponsor-defined phrase) information?; Who was the evaluator?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C96777

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the unique identifier assigned to the person making the evaluation.
fields.definition: An identifier used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in FAEVAL.
fields.implementationNotes: This variable is used in conjunction with FAEVAL to provide an additional level of detail.
fields.label: Findings About Evaluator Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: FAEVALID
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the identifier of the [evaluator name/reporter name] (providing the-sponsor-defined phrase-information)?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record whether the [FATEST] result was clinically significant.
fields.definition: An indication whether the test results were clinically significant.
fields.label: Findings About Clinical Significance
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPFA dataset as the value of SUPPFA.QVAL when SUPPFA.QNAM = "CLSIG" and SUPPFA.QLABEL = "Clinical Significance". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
fields.name: FACLSIG
fields.questionText: [Is/Was] the ([measurement/test/examination]) result clinically significant?

label: Findings About Events or Interventions
name: FA
